alert.note: Alert for Eastern Box Elder County; Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys; Utah Valley (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 5:54PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHWESTERN WEBER...CENTRAL BOX ELDER...SOUTHWESTERN SALT LAKE...WESTERN DAVIS...WEST CENTRAL UTAH AND EASTERN TOOELE COUNTIES... At 553 PM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from 20 miles southeast of Park Valley to 12 miles southwest of Dugway English Village...and moving east at 40 mph. Locations impacted include... Tooele, Grantsville, Tremonton, Dugway English Village, Stansbury Park, Howell, Vernon, Ophir, Delle, Tooele Army Depot, Tooele Army Depot South, Skull Valley, Great Salt Lake North of the Causeway, Great Salt Lake South of the Causeway, Bingham Canyon Mine, Utah Test and Training Range North, Stockton, Rush Valley, Hat Island and Penrose. This includes the following highways... Interstate 84 between mile markers 25 and 41. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 54 and 105. * strong winds in excess of 45 mph are possible with this squall. * visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this squall. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
